title: San Diego Padres logo - what font is this?
content:
I'm looking for this font, or a very similar:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PadresNewLogo_6021.jpg)

Anyone does know it?  
Thanks!
author: mandelbort

comments.content:
...

"The website declined to show this webpage  
 HTTP 403  
 Most likely causes:  
This website requires you to log in."

If you look at the bottom of your text edit box, you can see a button "Insert image", which does exactly what you would think it does -- no need for an external link.

Additionally, the "Type ID Board" has the following helpful line "Need to know what font it is? Post it here."
Sorry, i've just edit the post, thanks.

Read the [FAQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq) about sports logos (and thread titles).

- Lex

Hi Mandelbort,  
welcome to Typophile.

Here’s a list of script typefaces. I’m not saying that they are particularly similar to your sample, because that heavily depends on whether you want to emulate the overall appearance, whether you’re looking for the same writing tool or for certain letterforms. Scripts are quite unique.

[Brush Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Brush+Script&site=d&sample_text=Padres&sample_size=96) is an old fart. [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mark%20Simonson)’s [Kinescope](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mark_simonson/kinescope/?sample_text=Padres&sample_size=144) is a lot nicer. So is [Tomas Brousil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tomas%20Brousil)’s [Bistro Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/suitcase/bistroscript_regular/?sample_text=Padres&sample_size=144). [La Salle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/la_salle_regular_ot/?sample_text=Padres&sample_size=144).

There’s [Las Vegas Fabulous](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=27) by [House Industries](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/typophile.com/wiki/House%20Industries). Their [Sable](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.tdc.org/news/2008Results/Sable.html) wil be released soon.  
Letterheadfonts have several script fonts, American style, too: [Ball Park](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/ballparkscript.shtml), [Marie](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/mariescript.shtml), [Cosmic Cursive](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/cosmiccursive.shtml). And FontBros offer [Metroscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=ALSO-MESR), [Parsley Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=BLVI-PASC) and [Coffee Service](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=SIDE-COSE), among others.  
Two more essential addresses for nice retro and not-so-retro script fonts: [Sudtipos](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.sudtipos.com/) and [Fontdiner](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.fontdiner.com/).  
F

I love some of the [Letterhead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/) scripts, such as their new [Indian Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032417/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/indianscript.shtml).

Oh, thanks for the comments and the suggestions, i've changed the title of the post.  
Anyway the closer font seems to be the BistroScript
